title: José Pizarro’s strawberry gazpacho
time: Hands-on time 20 min, plus overnight chilling.
description: Spanish chef José Pizarro says: “It is undeniable that gazpacho is one of the star dishes of Andalusia. When I travelled to Malaga, I discovered that they add fruits such as grapes and melon to make it more nutritious and complex in flavour. Strawberry gazpacho sounds like an unusual incarnation of the traditional recipe, but the berries are very popular in Huelva, and the result is just terrific.”
ingredients: 700g ripe strawberries, hulled and chopped, with a few reserved for garnish
1 roasted red pepper from a jar, sliced
75ml extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling

method.Step 1: In a large bowl combine the tomatoes, strawberries, red pepper, shallot, garlic and sherry vinegar and leave to infuse overnight.

method.Step 2: The next day, add the extra-virgin olive oil and whizz together with a hand blender or in a food processor until smooth, adding a splash of water if it’s too thick. Season to taste.

method.Step 3: Pour a little olive oil into a frying pan over a medium heat and fry the sourdough cubes for 4-5 minutes until golden. Drain on kitchen paper and sprinkle with sea salt.

method.Step 4: Divide the gazpacho between six soup bowls and garnish with basil leaves and sourdough croutons. Finish with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil and some sea salt. Serve with a cold glass of amontillado or palo cortado sherry.
